edu.biu.scapi.interactiveMidProtocols.sigmaProtocol.and

Class SigmaANDVerifierComputation

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.biu.scapi.interactiveMidProtocols.sigmaProtocol.and.SigmaANDVerifierComputation
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    SigmaVerifierComputation

    public class SigmaANDVerifierComputation
extends java.lang.Object
implements SigmaVerifierComputation
    Concrete implementation of Sigma Protocol verifier computation.

    This protocol is used for a prover to convince a verifier that the AND of any number of statements are true, where each statement can be proven by an associated Sigma protocol.

    The pseudo code of this protocol can be found in Protocol 1.14 of pseudo codes document at http://crypto.biu.ac.il/scapi/SDK_Pseudocode_SCAPI_V2.0.0.pdf.

    Author:
    Cryptography and Computer Security Research Group Department of Computer Science Bar-Ilan University (Moriya Farbstein)

    • Constructor Detail

      • SigmaANDVerifierComputation

        public SigmaANDVerifierComputation(java.util.ArrayList<SigmaVerifierComputation> verifiers,
                           int t,
                           java.security.SecureRandom random)
        Constructor that gets the underlying verifiers.
        Parameters:
        verifiers - array of SigmaVerifierComputation, where each object represent a statement and the prover wants to prove to the verify that that the AND of all statements are true.
        t - soundness parameter. t MUST be equal to all t values of the underlying verifiers object.
        random - source of randomness
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the given t is not equal to all t values of the underlying verifiers object.

      • verify

        public boolean verify(SigmaCommonInput in,
             SigmaProtocolMsg a,
             SigmaProtocolMsg z)
        Computes the verification of the protocol.

        "ACC IFF all verifier checks are ACC".

        Specified by:
        verify in interface SigmaVerifierComputation
        Parameters:
        input - MUST be an instance of SigmaANDCommonInput.
        a - first message from prover
        z - second message from prover
        Returns:
        true if the proof has been verified; false, otherwise.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if input is not an instance of SigmaANDCommonInput.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the number of given inputs is different from the number of underlying verifier.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the first or second message of the prover is not an instance of SigmaMultipleMsg
